private_information: I should extract and canonicalize object names and propositional facts from the obfuscated description.
I must normalize predicates and provide a clear listing of action schemas and their referenced objects.
mapper.goal: Produce a normalized, unambiguous set of facts and action schema candidates for downstream analysis.

private_information: I should analyze causal dependencies, propose ordering constraints, and identify resource or predicate conflicts.
I may propose operator refinements but must not emit a final PDDL domain or problem.
reasoner.goal: Produce a dependency and refinement report that clarifies preconditions, effects, and likely interactions among actions.

private_information: I must audit temporal and causal consistency, remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens or post-hoc penalties, and flag implicit assumptions.
I focus on ensuring that causal chains are grounded in available initial facts and that effects do not rely on ephemeral bookkeeping constructs.
auditor.goal: Produce an audit report that corrects or annotates the analysis to make the model temporally and causally coherent.

private_information: I will integrate normalized facts, the dependency report, and the audit results to synthesize a final PDDL domain and problem.
The produced PDDL must be suitable for the FastDownwards planner and must keep actions of multiple agents distinct if applicable.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' outputs and produce a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeted at the FastDownwards solver.

public_information: Actions available: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted.
Predicates referenced: hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, stupendous, collect, spring.
Action paltry requires hand OBJ0 cats OBJ1 texture OBJ2 vase OBJ0 OBJ1 next OBJ1 OBJ2 and makes next OBJ0 OBJ2 true and makes vase OBJ0 OBJ1 false.
Action sip requires hand OBJ0 cats OBJ1 texture OBJ2 next OBJ0 OBJ2 next OBJ1 OBJ2 and makes vase OBJ0 OBJ1 true and makes next OBJ0 OBJ2 false.
Action clip requires hand OBJ0 sneeze OBJ1 texture OBJ2 next OBJ1 OBJ2 next OBJ0 OBJ2 and makes vase OBJ0 OBJ1 true and makes next OBJ0 OBJ2 false.
Action wretched requires sneeze OBJ0 texture OBJ1 texture OBJ2 stupendous OBJ3 next OBJ0 OBJ1 collect OBJ1 OBJ3 collect OBJ2 OBJ3 and makes next OBJ0 OBJ2 true and makes next OBJ0 OBJ1 false.
Action memory requires cats OBJ0 spring OBJ1 spring OBJ2 next OBJ0 OBJ1 and makes next OBJ0 OBJ2 true and makes next OBJ0 OBJ1 false.
Action tightfisted requires hand OBJ0 sneeze OBJ1 texture OBJ2 next OBJ1 OBJ2 vase OBJ0 OBJ1 and makes next OBJ0 OBJ2 true and makes vase OBJ0 OBJ1 false.

Initial facts include cats object_0 cats object_1 collect object_6 object_2 collect object_7 object_2 collect object_8 object_3 collect object_9 object_3 hand object_10 hand object_11 hand object_12 hand object_13 next object_0 object_8 next object_1 object_8 next object_10 object_7 next object_11 object_9 next object_12 object_8 next object_13 object_9 next object_4 object_7 next object_5 object_9 sneeze object_4 sneeze object_5 spring object_6 spring object_8 stupendous object_2 stupendous object_3 texture object_6 texture object_7 texture object_8 texture object_9.
Goal is next object_10 object_6 next object_11 object_8 next object_12 object_7 next object_13 object_9.

extract_facts.system_prompt: You are a domain normalization agent. Extract the propositional initial facts, enumerate objects, and propose canonical names for predicates and parameters. Normalize the obfuscated object labels and list candidate action schemas with parameter lists. Do not emit PDDL. Return a structured, machine-friendly report.
extract_facts.prompt: You are mapper. Use the public information and your private knowledge to output a normalized structured representation of objects predicates initial facts and candidate action schemas. Provide explicit mapping from obfuscated tokens like object_0 to canonical identifiers when appropriate.

analyze_dependencies.system_prompt: You are a causal analysis agent. Using the normalized facts, compute causal chains, ordering constraints, possible conflicts, and resource constraints among candidate actions. Do not emit PDDL. Provide explicit precondition-effect graphs, possible mutexes, and recommended operator refinements.
analyze_dependencies.prompt: You are reasoner. Based on the facts_normalized input and the public information produce a dependency report that clarifies temporal ordering and necessary sequencing to achieve the goal. Highlight any assumptions and alternatives.

audit.system_prompt: You are a temporal and causal auditor. Validate that chains of effects are grounded in the initial facts, remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as implicit quota tokens or post-hoc penalties, and annotate or correct any temporal misalignments. Do not emit PDDL. Your output must identify corrections and produce a cleaned causal model suitable for planning.
audit.prompt: You are auditor. Using facts_normalized and dependency_report produce an audit_report that removes bookkeeping shortcuts and ensures causal and temporal consistency. Flag any unsupported effects and propose minimal repairs.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and in preparing inputs for the FastDownwards solver. Integrate the normalized facts, the dependency report, and the audit results to synthesize a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file suitable for FastDownwards. Keep multi-agent actions distinct by prefixing operator names if they originate from different agents. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. Produce no other artifacts in the output.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. Integrate facts_normalized dependency_report and audit_report and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeted at the FastDownwards solver. Ensure predicates and action schemas reflect the cleaned causal model and that the initial state and goal match the public information. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem>.
